description:
Alterations, refurbishment and extensions to King's Cross Station to provide for new operational railway and passenger facilities, including construction of Western Concourse, demolition of southern concourse and landscaping of new southern square; alterations to Western Range; construction of platform Y and alterations to platforms 1 and 5-8; construction of canopies to south elevation of main train shed and taxi waiting areas; enclosure of London Underground SE stairs; permanent removal of Porte Cochere and northern canopy to Western Range, Great Northern Hotel porch and other items; demolition and replacement of Handyside pedestrian 
footbridge and demolition of elements of suburban train shed and of other structures; and other alterations, operations and extensions in connection with new uses and facilities.
decision_conditions:
The London Borough of Islington is disappointed that previous views have not been taken into account and  reiterates its objections to the proposed extension, refurbishment and alteration of King's Cross Station as previously set out in October 2006. In particular Islington objects to the lack of access to the station from the east side and to the proposed alterations to the front elevation including the installation of canopies. Objection is also raised to the loss of the porte cochere and the design of the rotunda.
The London Borough of Islington requests that it be involved in agreeing S106 heads of terms before negotiations begin with the developers.
As previously the views of the Kings Cross Conservation Area Advisory Committee are endorsed by the Council and the latest version is appended to this letter.
